Returns: true if and only if this stack contains no items; false otherwise.
empty().Description: Tests if this stack is empty.

Parameters: E: the item to be pushed onto this stack.
push(E).Description: Pushes an item onto the top of this stack. This has exactly the same effect as:

Returns: the object at the top of this stack (the last item of the Vector object).
peek().Description: Looks at the object at the top of this stack without removing it from the stack.

Returns: the 1-based position from the top of the stack where the object is located; the return value -1 indicates that the object is not on the stack.
search(java.lang.Object).Description: Returns the 1-based position where an object is on this stack. If the object

Returns: The object at the top of this stack (the last item of the Vector object).
pop().Description: Removes the object at the top of this stack and returns that object as the value of this function.

ClassDesc: The Stack class represents a last-in-first-out (LIFO) stack of objects. It extends class When a stack is first created, it contains no items. A more complete and consistent set of LIFO stack operations is provided by the @B_java#util#Deque_E@ interface and its implementations, which should be used in preference to this class. For example:
